title: Strengthening Deep Learning Practical Competencies: Work-Integrated Learning (WIL) and Online Learning for Practical Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic math knowledge and basic problem-solving experience in work settings
context.additional_context: Advanced AI/machine learning technical course for AI/ML practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can independently design a mathematical modeling process 100% autonomously using real-world workplace scenarios.
Learners apply statistical analysis techniques acquired from online learning modules to practical settings, producing three data-driven decision-making reports.

Learners identify three work-related problems during WIL, incorporate at least five peer feedback sessions from an LMS discussion board, and present two mathematical solutions in a PPT (10–15 slides). Solutions must score at least 4 out of 5 in two of three pre-evaluation rubric criteria (problem clarity, mathematical appropriateness, feasibility).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
